commit_message:
Fix sample configuration generation for compute-related options

Currently the compute_opts are duplicated in both [DEFAULT] and [compute]
sections, while compute_group_opts are missing at all.

This patch does not affect where the options actually are, only where
they are displayed in the sample configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1712855

Change-Id: I68f246998fd68e669b0d9ef34b00ed384f4f0c90
(cherry picked from commit 64cb56c81a7309a667eea2ce85147e62d02cac91)

commit_message:
image-create-via-import fails with ValueError

CLI image-create-via-import fails with ValueError. The reason
is create command returns RequestIdWrapper object and not image
and response.

Further it fails with AttributeError: 'Namespace' object has
no attribute 'import_method'. The reason is do_import_image() call
requires 'import_method' as input which is not provided at the
moment.

Change-Id: Ic4c4d1f3c5d290b584840e8f9047fb53611a5748
Closes-bug: #1711511
(cherry picked from commit 335f1e944719023a887730a223353a4bdb209815)

subject: Migrate openvswitch-switch file to avoid restarts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-23 02:31:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch/commit/aa5ac24391d05e2d823d68556a30688b09d40d9d', 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary service restarts

Commit 4463c334 introduced a restart_trigger option allowing
remote services to trigger restarts of various services provided
by the neutron-openvswitch charm. This seemingly innocuous change
alters the openvswitch-switch template to add restart_trigger to
the file header, which changes the contents of the file and causes
a restart of the openvswitch-switch service. This restart causes
a disruption to the data plane.

This change introduces logic into the RemoteRestartContext that
determines whether openvswitch-switch config file needs to include
the restart_trigger section. This is done in a way that the charm
will avoid altering the contents of the openvswitch-switch file
unless a configuration change has actually been requested, or a
remote application requests a restart.

Change-Id: Icc0f326991be239b88a57292740473f501181ebb
Closes-Bug: #1712444
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-23 22:38:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch/commit/ebdcdaec5b1282b464b95c4faa2844aabbd803fe', 'message': 'Migrate openvswitch-switch file to avoid restarts

The 16.10 release of the neutron-openvswitch charm changed the
file management strategy of /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
config file from managing the file when dpdk is enabled to always
managing the file. Additionally, the template file was changed
in the 16.10 release to modify the file header (commit 4463c334).
These two changes guarantee that the contents of the file will
change when upgrading the charm.

The changing file contents causes the openvswitch-switch service
to be restarted, which in turn causes a data plane outage. This
commit fixes that by migrating the /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
to be charm managed without restarting the openvswitch-switch
service.

The change will only attempt to migrate versions of the file
which were created before 16.10 by searching for a marker in the
rendered version of the file which was added in 16.10.

Change-Id: Icc0f326991be239b88a57292740473f501181ebb
Closes-Bug: #1712444
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-23 22:39:44.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/16.07-dpdk-openvswitch-switch', 'unit_tests/16.10-openvswitch-switch', 'unit_tests/test_neutron_ovs_hooks.py', 'hooks/neutron_ovs_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/package-provided-openvswitch-switch'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch/commit/e3ec31c91df72cf64f79f14e0223ec61382c0553', 'message': 'Migrate openvswitch-switch file to avoid restarts

The 16.10 release of the neutron-openvswitch charm changed the
file management strategy of /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
config file from managing the file when dpdk is enabled to always
managing the file. Additionally, the template file was changed
in the 16.10 release to modify the file header (commit 4463c334).
These two changes guarantee that the contents of the file will
change when upgrading the charm.

The changing file contents causes the openvswitch-switch service
to be restarted, which in turn causes a data plane outage. This
commit fixes that by migrating the /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
to be charm managed without restarting the openvswitch-switch
service.

The change will only attempt to migrate versions of the file
which were created before 16.10 by searching for a marker in the
rendered version of the file which was added in 16.10.

Change-Id: Icc0f326991be239b88a57292740473f501181ebb
Closes-Bug: #1712444
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate openvswitch-switch file to avoid restarts

The 16.10 release of the neutron-openvswitch charm changed the
file management strategy of /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
config file from managing the file when dpdk is enabled to always
managing the file. Additionally, the template file was changed
in the 16.10 release to modify the file header (commit 4463c334).
These two changes guarantee that the contents of the file will
change when upgrading the charm.

The changing file contents causes the openvswitch-switch service
to be restarted, which in turn causes a data plane outage. This
commit fixes that by migrating the /etc/default/openvswitch-switch
to be charm managed without restarting the openvswitch-switch
service.

The change will only attempt to migrate versions of the file
which were created before 16.10 by searching for a marker in the
rendered version of the file which was added in 16.10.

Change-Id: Icc0f326991be239b88a57292740473f501181ebb
Closes-Bug: #1712444
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch refs/changes/64/496464/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cached,@cached def has_restart_trigger_heading(): """Determines if the restart_trigger section already exists in a configuration file. Some versions of the charm installed will already have a restart_trigger section added even when a restart has never been requested by a remote relation (e.g. >= 16.10). In this case, the restart_trigger section should continue to be included in the rendered template in order to prevent a subsequent restart of the data plane. In other cases, the version of the charm installed will not have a restart_trigger section added (e.g. < 16.10). In this scenario, the charm should not render the restart_trigger section of the configuration file. Doing so would cause the contents of the file to change, which in turn causes the services to be restarted in the @restart_on_change guards. :return bool: True if the charm has previously rendered the restart_trigger heading, False otherwise. """ # The charm doesn't know which version it is, so check whether or not the # restart_triggered section has been rendered based on whether the # /etc/default/openvswitch-switch file contains the text: "Service restart # triggered by remote application:". This should be enough to determine # if the charm includes the offending template change or not and the # restart_trigger heading needs to be resolved (LP #1712444). with open('/etc/default/openvswitch-switch', 'r') as f: # Note: the openvswitch-switch file should be fairly small, so f.read # should be acceptable. Also, caching the response so this will only # read the file once per hook invocation. return 'Service restart triggered by remote application:' in f.read() # LP:1712444 - don't always render the restart_trigger section in # order to avoid restarting data plane services unnecessarily (e.g. # openvswitch-switch). if has_restart_trigger_heading() or any(ctxt.values()): ctxt['enable_restart_trigger'] = True

also be referenced as a way to do this since not everybody uses spaces. This

commit_message:
my_ip should belong to internal-network rather than data-network

When defining os-data-network=10.10.1.0/24,
os-internal-network=10.12.1.0/24 and not defining os-data-space,
private-address of nova-compute units will be in 10.10.1.0/24 because
now 10.10.1.0/24 and 10.12.1.0/24 are all in internal-network.

nova-cloud-controller units can't collect public keys of nova-compute
units because they don't have NIC belonged to 10.10.1.0/24. This will
lead to some problems when resizing/migrating VM.

This problem can be fixed by defining os-internal-space for
cloud-compute because at this time private-address of nova-compute
units will be in 10.12.1.0/24.

    bindings:
      cloud-compute: *os-internal-space

However, the nova-compute charm has an os-internal-network option,
this should also be referenced as a way to do this since not
everybody uses spaces. This patch is used to deliver this point,
then we can fix this problem by running the following command:

juju config nova-compute os-internal-network='10.12.1.0/24'

Change-Id: I70b096fd709e5ec8d8a47d2d11f71ed3ea780c5d
Closes-Bug: 1686882
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-compute refs/changes/58/469758/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Data Network support =========== neutron-openvswitch charm and neutron-gateway charm can use os-data-network option to set local_ip for tenant network traffic in overlay networks. At this time, nova-compute charm should also explicitly declare using internal network as my_ip instead of data network. ``` juju deploy nova-compute --bind "cloud-compute=internal-space" ``` alternatively these can also be provided as part of a juju native bundle configuration: ```yaml nova-compute: charm: cs:xenial/nova-compute num_units: 1 bindings: cloud-compute: *os-internal-space ```

commit_message:
Just changed the opening of the file

Previous code worked fine in python 2.7 but generated
"ResourceWarning: Unclosed file" in python 3.4+
Does not change the funtionality of the code at all.
Also updated the unit tests to work with the new code.

Change-Id: If98df5c4905f4b5a22602ba19224f9368fc8129f

added_lines: with open(file_path) as white_file: for line in white_file.read().splitlines(): split_line = line.strip().split('#') # Before the # is the regex line_regex = split_line[0].strip() if line_regex: lines.append(line_regex) with open(blacklist_file, 'r') as black_file: exclude_regex = '' for line in black_file: raw_line = line.strip() split_line = raw_line.split('#') # Before the # is the regex line_regex = split_line[0].strip() if len(split_line) > 1: # After the # is a comment comment = split_line[1].strip() else: comment = '' if line_regex: if print_exclude: print_skips(line_regex, comment) if exclude_regex: exclude_regex = '|'.join([line_regex, exclude_regex]) else: exclude_regex = line_regex if exclude_regex: exclude_regex = "^((?!" + exclude_regex + ").)*$"
deleted_lines: for line in open(file_path).read().splitlines(): split_line = line.strip().split('#') # Before the # is the regex line_regex = split_line[0].strip() if line_regex: lines.append(line_regex) black_file = open(blacklist_file, 'r') exclude_regex = '' for line in black_file: raw_line = line.strip() split_line = raw_line.split('#') # Before the # is the regex line_regex = split_line[0].strip() if len(split_line) > 1: # After the # is a comment comment = split_line[1].strip() else: comment = '' if line_regex: if print_exclude: print_skips(line_regex, comment) if exclude_regex: exclude_regex = '|'.join([line_regex, exclude_regex]) else: exclude_regex = line_regex if exclude_regex: exclude_regex = "^((?!" + exclude_regex + ").)*$"

commit_message:
Remove identity v3 change_password test

This commit removes the v3 change_password test because
it is currently getting skipped [0], because the policy
action does not exist in [1] and the API where it would
be enforced does not enforce it [2].

So the correct approach is to remove the test. Also renames
the class name to drop "Admin" substring as there is nothing
about this test class that requires admin credentials in any
way.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/68/496068/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial/7069c22/console.html#_2017-08-23_00_50_18_947787
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/common/policies/user.py
[2] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/4950c24bddaf98b79dfd9ee178ae1086cf48e322/keystone/identity/controllers.py#L279

subject: Set self.allow to a dict if None is passed
revisions:

This used to use a mutable default which would result in self.allow
always being a dict. Since allow is a public attribute, even though
keystoneauth1/identity/base.py does allow = allow or {} at the usage
place, we need to make sure it's a dict here too.

Change-Id: I388b8d7859744a1e7bd454641aaf98e4b6caa3b0
"}]
commit_message:
Set self.allow to a dict if None is passed

This used to use a mutable default which would result in self.allow
always being a dict. Since allow is a public attribute, even though
keystoneauth1/identity/base.py does allow = allow or {} at the usage
place, we need to make sure it's a dict here too.

Change-Id: I388b8d7859744a1e7bd454641aaf98e4b6caa3b0

commit_message:
[TrivialFix] Move security group tests into correct test file

This commit moves security group tests currently in test_server_rbac
into test_security_groups_rbac as that is the logical place
for the tests. And this commit renames the deprecated security
groups test class to avoid a name conflict with the non-deprecated
test class.

Change-Id: Iae32d9bc7e22e39415e498e44f0da4f2711dc550

commit_message:
Change perms for the VM logs

When logs were under a directory without read permissions,
bifrost was not able to create the vm log files for centos/suse
and were not published.

Change-Id: Ifcc31c611edd34acb4fc3c1bb67bbe2a528d93cc

commit_message:
Add backward compatible connection attribute

Previously, IDL referenced to Connection with connection attribute.
Change I379448fd135a3bb2ac99709812b9f476c73923a7 switched to
ovsdb_connection attribute. This patch adds a property returning
ovsdb_connection for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I60888baf053b3ff643757aa2cb3a7cd2c75e3cf6
Related-bug: #1712594

commit_message:
Add functional test for rescheduling during a migration

This adds a functional test which recreates the bug where
the allocations on a destination node are not removed from
Placement before rescheduling during a cold migrate operation,
which is the same code flow as a resize even though resize
isn't explicitly tested here.

Change-Id: I1e3def1e98d0008240837eb1ad0eaa81a9b2d189
Related-Bug: #1712850
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/497541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_rescheduling_when_migrating_instance(self): """Tests that allocations are removed from the destination node by the compute service when a cold migrate / resize fails and a reschedule request is sent back to conductor. """ source_hostname = self.compute1.manager.host server = self._boot_and_check_allocations( self.flavor1, source_hostname) def fake_prep_resize(*args, **kwargs): raise test.TestingException('Simulated _prep_resize failure.') # Yes this isn't great in a functional test, but it's simple. self.stub_out('nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager._prep_resize', fake_prep_resize) # Now migrate the server which is going to fail on the destination. self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], {'migrate': None}) # When the destination compute calls conductor and conductor calls # the scheduler to get another host, it's going to fail since there # are only two hosts and we started on the first and failed on the # second, so the scheduler will raise NoValidHost and a fault will # be recorded on the instance. However, the instance is not put into # ERROR state since it's still OK on the source host, but faults are # only shown in the API for ERROR/DELETED instances, so we can't poll # for the fault. So we poll for instance action events instead. completion_event = None for attempt in range(10): actions = self.api.get_instance_actions(server['id']) # Look for the migrate action. for action in actions: if action['action'] == 'migrate': events = ( self.api.api_get( '/servers/%s/os-instance-actions/%s' % (server['id'], action['request_id']) ).body['instanceAction']['events']) # Look for the compute_prep_resize being in error state. for event in events: if (event['event'] == 'compute_prep_resize' and event['result'] is not None and event['result'].lower() == 'error'): completion_event = event # Break out of the events loop. break if completion_event: # Break out of the actions loop. break # We didn't find the completion event yet, so wait a bit. time.sleep(0.5) if completion_event is None: self.fail('Timed out waiting for compute_prep_resize failure ' 'event. Current instance actions: %s' % actions) dest_hostname = self._other_hostname(source_hostname) dest_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(dest_hostname) failed_usages = self._get_provider_usages(dest_rp_uuid) # FIXME(mriedem): Due to bug 1712850 the allocations are not removed # from the destination node before the reschedule. Remove this once # the bug is fixed as it should be: # # Expects no allocation records on the failed host. # self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation( # {'vcpus': 0, 'ram': 0, 'disk': 0}, failed_usages) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, failed_usages) # Ensure the allocation records still exist on the source host. source_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(source_hostname) source_usages = self._get_provider_usages(source_rp_uuid) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, source_usages)

commit_message:
rehome extraroute api definition

This patch rehomes neutron's extraroute API definition into
neutron-lib as well as the associated exceptions into their respective
exception module.

UTs and a release note are also included.

Change-Id: I0425384d5fd6864f336bd7a5c9a5e70f2b3568ff

commit_message:
Api-ref: Reorganize volumes versions

In v2 sample path, there are redundant files version-v2-show-response.json,
in v3 sample path, there are redundant files version-v2-show-response.json
and version-v3-show-response.json, This patch is to remove the redundant
JSON file and reorganize volumes versions of v2 and v3

Change-Id: I3d9337cc94ad02138459742a7b84fe97bd09bb90

Release TripleO Pike - RC1

* instack-undercloud 7.3.0 + stable/pike branch
* puppet-tripleo 7.3.0 + stable/pike branch
* tripleo-common 7.5.0 + stable/pike branch
* tripleo-heat-templates 7.0.0.0rc1 + stable/pike branch
* tripleo-image-elements 7.0.0.0rc1 + stable/pike branch
* tripleo-puppet-elements 7.0.0.0rc1 + stable/pike branch
* tripleo-ui 7.3.0 + stable/pike branch
* tripleo-validations 7.3.0 + stable/pike branch

Change-Id: I80460f8cec320712353a5371c5e2bcd46cb6e039

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in test/unit/account tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: Icdbf3c63fe8dd6db1129023885655a9f7032d4a7

commit_message:
[WIP] Avoid running pip_install twice

This patch is a test to see if we can avoid running the pip_install
role twice. It is applied as a role dependency, which causes it to
run during the initial RabbitMQ installation and during the upgrade
test. That causes delays in the gate.

Change-Id: I0bc0a10d1a9e19b424f0a330a5bee1b93cb4f261

commit_message:
Modify a little desc to satisfy the code

The method for attaching to update the status of the volume in the
DB is cinder.volume.api.reserve_volume in code and the method for
attaching to finalize the status of the volume and release the
resourece is cinder.volume.api.attach(self, context, volume,
instance_uuid, host_name, mountpoint, mode) in code.

Change-Id: I1af560d5840296d28d6f005b7758b6e75faa727e

Config option will have no effect for >= Ocata.
Also adds log WARNING.

Closes-Bug: 1691080

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-23 21:39:24.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/b05aede84bbcb3707be1c4da0c596844ae1f2a60', 'message': 'Fix cleaning of Cinder volumes in functional tests

There is some issue, probably with Cinder which cause sometimes
problem with removing of volumes. Such volumes stuck in "deleting"
state in Cinder.

This patch changes cleanup method from functional Cinder test that
it will not raise exception (and make test fails) if volumes will
not be cleaned properly.
In such case cleaning will try to delete volume once again with
"force=True" and will move forward if it also fails.

This change shouldn't cause any new problem with reached volumes quota

Change-Id: I984f863b55b46fe6eba4a7ec31434ee4d2baa16f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cleaning of Cinder volumes in functional tests

There is some issue, probably with Cinder which cause sometimes
problem with removing of volumes. Such volumes stuck in "deleting"
state in Cinder.

This patch changes cleanup method from functional Cinder test that
it will not raise exception (and make test fails) if volumes will
not be cleaned properly.
In such case cleaning will try to delete volume once again with
"force=True" and will move forward if it also fails.

This change shouldn't cause any new problem with reached volumes quota
limits becasue before this patch such volumes were also not removed
properly.

Change-Id: I984f863b55b46fe6eba4a7ec31434ee4d2baa16f

commit_message:
Do not require OpenStack authentication to run osprofiler CLI

OpenStack authentication is needed by Ceilometer driver only
and is annoying when other drivers are used. The way we currently
verify os-parameters is conceptually wrong: first it covers only
subset of possible variations, second it differs from implementation
inside of python-ceilometerclient.

Change-Id: I3bbb7c47170064728790b22393f6071be3ace336
Closes-bug: 1653062

commit_message:
image-create-via-import fails with ValueError

CLI image-create-via-import fails with ValueError. The reason
is create command returns RequestIdWrapper object and not image
and response.

Further it fails with AttributeError: 'Namespace' object has
no attribute 'import_method'. The reason is do_import_image() call
requires 'import_method' as input which is not provided at the
moment.

Change-Id: Ic4c4d1f3c5d290b584840e8f9047fb53611a5748
Closes-bug: #1711511

commit_message:
VStorage: manage volume types for ploop and qcow2 volumes

VStorage driver can create volumes in multiple formats,
that are suitable for both virtual machines (qcow2) and
containers (ploop). To choose between volume formats the
vendor property vz:volume_format should be set in volume
type extra specs. Thus we need 2 volume types to support
both VMs and containers.

Change-Id: I7ffce9c16dfa524a3eac2e8d12ad7fd0b682eba6
Depends-On: Ib610e6f9c82259f9dd2db37178b24d964a38e20d
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/02/465102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cinder_type { "${volume_backend_name}-qcow2": properties => ["vz:volume_format=qcow2"], } cinder_type { "${volume_backend_name}-ploop": ensure => present, properties => ["vz:volume_format=ploop"],

commit_message:
Update discovery url normalization with catalog info

There's an unfortunately common deployment config issue where the
per-service version discovery document doesn't return scheme and netloc
properly. (Especially common with glance, as there was an actually
upstream bug in the version discovery documents until very recently)
Since up until now nobody has actually been doing version discovery
(all of the python-client libs skip it and cheat by appending strings
to URLs locally) it's a pervassive issue with existing clouds.

The workaround is to grab the scheme and netloc from the catalog url,
since the service_url is a resource on the endpoint described by the
catalog_url, and since the catalog_url has to be correct or else nothing
works. Do this in the url normalization so that it persists in the
cache, and so that things like endpoint_override are not affected.

The need for the workaround and the description of it are documented in
the API-SIG spec on consuming version discovery.

Needed-By: I78019717cdee79cab43b0d11e737327aa281fd03
Change-Id: I29102e08998b662db8136bee32217532a316f263

subject: Add method to get the api major version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-16 13:01:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/0e98071edae5c22fa28141131e344ef89798ae68', 'message': "Add method to get the api version

Similar to get_endpoint, which knows it doesn't need full endpoint_data,
if a user just wants to know what major version the discovery process
wound up with, there are cases in which we do not need to fetch
discovery documents. Provide an API call that a user can use when this
is the information they need to avoid them having to play games with
discover_versions settings.

Change-Id: I204a45d1d139a90176bcc2ef8d46decd09b2cd5b
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-16 17:16:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/c02fbc08ce0f5f034c229a3ad03a1997e0e38a05', 'message': "Add method to get the api major version

Similar to get_endpoint, which knows it doesn't need full endpoint_data,
if a user just wants to know what major version the discovery process
wound up with, there are cases in which we do not need to fetch
discovery documents. Provide an API call that a user can use when this
is the information they need to avoid them having to play games with

commit_message:
Add method to get the api major version

Similar to get_endpoint, which knows it doesn't need full endpoint_data,
if a user just wants to know what major version the discovery process
wound up with, there are cases in which we do not need to fetch
discovery documents. Provide an API call that a user can use when this
is the information they need to avoid them having to play games with
discover_versions settings.

Change-Id: I204a45d1d139a90176bcc2ef8d46decd09b2cd5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/93/494193/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_api_version(self, auth=None, **kwargs): """Get the major API version as provided by the auth plugin. :param auth: The auth plugin to use for token. Overrides the plugin on the session. (optional) :type auth: keystoneauth1.plugin.BaseAuthPlugin :raises keystoneauth1.exceptions.auth_plugins.MissingAuthPlugin: if a plugin is not available. :return: The major version of the API of the service discovered. :rtype: tuple or None """ self._set_endpoint_filter_kwargs(kwargs) if self.endpoint_override: kwargs['endpoint_override'] = self.endpoint_override return self.session.get_api_version(auth or self.auth, **kwargs)

Add support of network topology

This commit add "network topology list" and
"network topology show" function.

Change-Id: Ib3a56fb3d8b2dbe0749ab1a7c8c08c3654d1479f
Co-authored-by: Songming Yan <yan.songming@zte.com.cn>
Implements: blueprint network-topology-support

commit_message:
Allow filtering network ports by fixed_ips

The patch in [1] introduced filtering network ports by fixed-ip in the
openstackclient, but it doesn't really work because the filter isn't
accepted in the sdk.

Add that option and add an unit test for the filter list.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/388575

Change-Id: I6cbb7f1aaff8ad12234f68ddb3fe564c556ece54
Closes-Bug: 1712527

commit_message:
[WIP] Split network v2 and compute network doc

Since nova and neutron network are significantly different,
it makes sense to split the documentation.

Work items:
* Split network.rst (done)
* Split floating-ip.rst
* Split security-group.rst
* Split security-group-rule.rst


Change-Id: I9829220d6f9731b629fbe513475ec679bb7ec269

commit_message:
Security: Container user and rootwrap for neutron

This PS adds user control for the service user and rootwrap for
the Neutron chart.

Change-Id: Ibefa3e76c9e64427e97cdcbb93a11d2b2125e171

subject: Add options for easily booting from a new volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 02:01:59.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/397329b5091098328ac1d2e714731f222b4b81a4', 'message': "Add options for easily booting from a new volume

Previously, the only option to boot from a volume using OpenStack
client consisted of using the --block-device-mapping option. This
option requires that the volume already exists prior running the
server create command as per the v1 specification of block device
mapping. Since the addition of the v2 block device mapping format
the compute API can create the volume from a source type such as
an image or a snapshot, and attach it to use it as the boot disk
for the new instance, all during the create request.

Instead of simply exposing the block device mapping v2 format
directly, this exposes a set of options that allows the user to
specify a boot-disk-type which maps to the destination type in
the v2 format, and it the source type is assume to always be either
an image or snapshot. For more complex block device mapping, then
it's suggested to use the --block-device-mapping option.

Exposing the block device mapping v2 format direclty
can be cumbersome to use since permitted values cannot be easily
discovered and does not indicate which are required and which are
optional without out of band knowledge (docs).

Change-Id: Ie041e7a7722ef320ae3da61eac8e836a4a262c00
"}]
commit_message:
Add options for easily booting from a new volume

Previously, the only option to boot from a volume using OpenStack
client consisted of using the --block-device-mapping option. This
option requires that the volume already exists prior running the
server create command as per the v1 specification of block device
mapping. Since the addition of the v2 block device mapping format
the compute API can create the volume from a source type such as
an image or a snapshot, and attach it to use it as the boot disk
for the new instance, all during the create request.

Instead of simply exposing the block device mapping v2 format
directly, this exposes a set of options that allows the user to
specify a boot-disk-type which maps to the destination type in
the v2 format, and it the source type is assume to always be either
an image or snapshot. For more complex block device mapping, then
it's suggested to use the --block-device-mapping option.

Exposing the block device mapping v2 format direclty
can be cumbersome to use since permitted values cannot be easily
discovered and does not indicate which are required and which are
optional without out of band knowledge (docs).

Change-Id: Ie041e7a7722ef320ae3da61eac8e836a4a262c00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/82/300282/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--boot-disk-type', metavar='<disk-type>', default=None, help=_('The type of the boot disk. This option can only be ' 'specified for a new boot disk and not for booting from ' 'an existing volume. Valid values are "local" or ' '"volume".'), ) parser.add_argument( '--boot-disk-size', metavar='<size-GB>', type=int, default=0, help=_('The size of the boot disk. This option can only be ' 'specified for a new boot disk. Disk size must be in GB. ' 'If 0 defaults to min_disk for "local". When disk type is ' '"volume" a disk size greater than 0 must be set. This ' 'option is ignored if "--boot-disk-type" option ' 'is not set.'), ) parser.add_argument( '--boot-disk-device-name', metavar='<dev-name>', help=_('The device name of the boot disk. This option can only be ' 'specified for a new boot disk and not for boot from an ' 'existing volume. If not set defaults to device name in ' 'the image metadata. Commonly it is not set. This option ' 'is ignored if "--boot-disk-type" option is not set.'), ) parser.add_argument( '--boot-disk-auto-remove', action='store_true', help=_('Automatically deletes volume used as boot disk. This ' 'option only applies for boot disk with "volume" type. ' 'A "local" boot disk type is ephemeral if this option is ' 'set it will be ignore. This option is ignored if ' '"--boot-disk-type" option is not set.'), ) parser.add_argument( block_device_mapping_v2 = [] if parsed_args.boot_disk_type: if parsed_args.boot_disk_type not in ('local', 'volume',): msg = _("Valid values for boot disk type are 'local' or " "'volume'") raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) if (parsed_args.boot_disk_type == 'volume' and parsed_args.boot_disk_size <= 0): msg = _("A volume size greater than 0 must be specified if " "--boot-disk-type=volume is specified") raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) # Remove image from boot args since we are boot from volume boot_args = [parsed_args.server_name, None, flavor] remove_volume = parsed_args.boot_disk_auto_remove bdm_dict = {'uuid': image.id, 'source_type': 'image', 'destination_type': parsed_args.boot_disk_type, 'boot_index': 0, 'delete_on_termination': remove_volume} if parsed_args.boot_disk_type == 'volume': bdm_dict['volume_size'] = parsed_args.boot_disk_size if parsed_args.boot_disk_device_name: bdm_dict['device_name'] = parsed_args.boot_disk_device_name if hasattr(image, 'metadata') and 'image_type' in image.metadata: if image.metadata['image_type'] == 'snapshot': bdm_dict['source_type'] = 'snapshot' block_device_mapping_v2.append(bdm_dict) if block_device_mapping and block_device_mapping_v2: msg = _("Cannot mix block device mapping formats") raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) block_device_mapping_v2=block_device_mapping_v2,

commit_message:
Add python-tackerclient to OSC plugin

OSC plugin is a command-line client for OpenStack that brings the command
set together.Some OpenStack service have implemented their clients as an OSC
plugin.So Tacker may do the same.

Change-Id: Ia6b5567e75f859f2171443a5033a4e9d1e9db599

Support setting volume bootable flag

Add the functionality of setting volume bootable
flag which indicates whether user can boot a VM
from the volume.

Closes-Bug:#1535704

added_lines: from osc_lib import exceptions # Properties should get flattened into the general kwargs reserved = ('name', 'id', 'enabled', 'description') if getattr(parsed_args, 'property', None): for k, v in six.iteritems(parsed_args.property): if k in reserved: raise exceptions.CommandError( _("ERROR: %s is a reserved attribute." % k)) else: kwargs[k] = str(v) if v is None: info.pop(k)
deleted_lines: if parsed_args.property: kwargs.update(parsed_args.property) properties = {} # If a key is not in `reserved` it's a property, pop it info.pop(k) if v is not None: properties[k] = v info['properties'] = utils.format_dict(properties)

subject: Migrate "image show" command to osc from glanceclient.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 10:36:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/image/client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-migrate-glanceclient-to-osc-4a195d904c26e157.yaml', 'openstackclient/image/v2/image.py', 'functional/tests/image/v2/test_image.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/d6adbb6e2b741d57a0353d2d55ebf8e6c46c8904', 'message': 'Migrate "image show" command to osc from glanceclient.

This patch add a new "image show" command which is supported by SDK.
The old "image show" command still can be used because this new command
is a beta command and needs to be used with "--os-beta-command" option.

The reasons of using "--os-beta-command" for this command are as belows:
1.Using "--os-beta-command" option can retaining the old command, we'd
better retain the old command which is depend on glanceclient until the
SDK support is good enough.
2.When we migrate a image command, we should insure others image command
can be used and were not be influenced. Using "--os-beta-command" can
meeting this requirement.

Partially-Implements: blueprint migrate-glanceclient-to-osc
Change-Id: Ief52766a5976ca06558bb5be0aa90fa91f034f7d
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate "image show" command to osc from glanceclient.

This patch add a new "image show" command which is supported by SDK.
The old "image show" command still can be used because this new command
is a beta command and needs to be used with "--os-beta-command" option.

The reasons of using "--os-beta-command" for this command are as belows:
1.Using "--os-beta-command" option can retaining the old command, we'd
better retain the old command which is depend on glanceclient until the
SDK support is good enough.
2.When we migrate a image command, we should insure others image command
can be used and were not be influenced. Using "--os-beta-command" can
meeting this requirement.

Partially-Implements: blueprint migrate-glanceclient-to-osc
Change-Id: Ief52766a5976ca06558bb5be0aa90fa91f034f7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/22/331022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_image_show_beta(self): opts = self.get_show_opts(self.FIELDS) raw_output = self.openstack( '--os-beta-command image show ' + self.NAME + opts) self.assertEqual(self.NAME + "\n", raw_output)

commit_message:
Test new cliff column formatting

Move some of the column formatting into cliff to handle the
machine/human readable bits, this is a POC of using that in OSC
using image list and show.

Depends-on: Ic84b05ae720188a63a11151e012997416544ac34
Change-Id: I7190d88b3619c162855820ab5ec3fe408c83b198
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/61/330261/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cliff import columns# NOTE(dtroyer): These clearly belongs in cliff or osc-lib, they are here for # demonstration purposes ;) class DictColumn(columns.FormattableColumn): """Format column as a dict""" def human_readable(self): if isinstance(self._value, dict): output = "" for s in sorted(self._value): output = output + s + "='" + \ six.text_type(self._value[s]) + "'; " return output[:-2] # What should the non-normal handling be? return self._value class ListColumn(columns.FormattableColumn): """Format column as a dict""" def __init__(self, value, separator=', '): super(ListColumn, self).__init__(value) self._separator = separator def human_readable(self): if isinstance(self._value, list): return self._separator.join(sorted(self._value)) # What should the non-normal handling be? return self._value info['tags'] = ListColumn(image.get('tags')) info['properties'] = DictColumn(properties)

commit_message:
Format external gateway info output

This patch improves the external gateway info output
format in "router show", "router list" and
"router create" command.

Before this patch, the output was:
| external_gateway_info   | enable_snat='True', external_fixed_ips='[{u'subnet_id': u'1f96272b-dbb3-44d3-abdb-267ccb3b2673', u'ip_address': u'172.24.4.2'}, {u'subnet_id': u'40b03ae3-0b89-4719-aa9d-             |
|                         | d4770e9adf19', u'ip_address': u'2001:db8::1'}]', network_id='cc6e2d7b-5eb5-4eda-8a4a-11a1864a47b0'

After this patch, it will become:
| external_gateway_info   | enable_snat='True'                                                         |
|                         | network_id='cc6e2d7b-5eb5-4eda-8a4a-11a1864a47b0'                          |
|                         | external_fixed_ips:                                                        |
|                         | ip_address='172.24.4.2', subnet_id='1f96272b-dbb3-44d3-abdb-267ccb3b2673'  |
|                         | ip_address='2001:db8::1', subnet_id='40b03ae3-0b89-4719-aa9d-d4770e9adf19' |

Change-Id: Idecb4ebbd40bfaca788c593c0ae9eaa74eae04fc
Partial-bug: #1519503

commit_message:
Do not print "headers" when creating network resource

network.create_xxx() in sdk will return an object with an attribute
named "headers" with some info which means nothing to users, like this:

# openstack network create bbb
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field          | Value                                |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up | UP                                   |
| headers        |                                      |
| id             | 17f3ab2d-ecba-4e36-b52c-218852e3c89d |
| name           | bbb                                  |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+

So filter it out in get_columns(). After this patch, it will be like
this:

# openstack network create bbb
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field          | Value                                |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up | UP                                   |
| id             | 17f3ab2d-ecba-4e36-b52c-218852e3c89d |
| name           | bbb                                  |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+

Change-Id: Ic90606a35b457f68068a7dbd989e421eb62bf1f4

commit_message:
Add extensions support for os port commands

Added support for extensions in port commands.
Operations on extensions such as Security Groups,
Allowed Address Pairs, QoS and Extra DHCP Opts
now supported.

Change-Id: I71bce6b271b06b732dfcc2a04b80bb157a4972fb
Partial-bug: #1519909
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-client
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/49/290849/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _prepare_fixed_ips(client_manager, parsed_args) if parsed_args.security_groups is not None: _prepare_security_groups(client_manager, parsed_args) attrs['security_groups'] = parsed_args.security_groups if parsed_args.extra_dhcp_opts is not None: _prepare_dhcp_opts(parsed_args) attrs['extra_dhcp_opts'] = parsed_args.extra_dhcp_opts if parsed_args.qos_policy is not None: attrs['qos_policy_id'] = parsed_args.qos_policy if parsed_args.allowed_address_pairs is not None: _prepare_address_pairs(parsed_args) attrs['allowed_address_pairs'] = parsed_args.allowed_address_pairs _network = client_manager.network.find_network(parsed_args.network, ignore_missing=False) attrs['network_id'] = _network.iddef _prepare_dhcp_opts(parsed_args): final_dhcp_opts = [] for dhcp_opt in parsed_args.extra_dhcp_opts: fixed_dhcp_opt = {} # Anything that isn't ip-v is an opt_name: opt_value pair # separate these to submit in request for opt_name, opt_val in dhcp_opt.iteritems(): if opt_name == 'ip-version': fixed_dhcp_opt['ip_version'] = opt_val else: fixed_dhcp_opt['opt_name'] = opt_name fixed_dhcp_opt['opt_value'] = opt_val final_dhcp_opts.append(fixed_dhcp_opt) parsed_args.extra_dhcp_opts = final_dhcp_opts def _prepare_address_pairs(parsed_args): for addr_pair in parsed_args.allowed_address_pairs: if 'ip-address' in addr_pair: addr_pair['ip_address'] = addr_pair['ip-address'] del addr_pair['ip-address'] if 'mac-address' in addr_pair: addr_pair['mac_address'] = addr_pair['mac-address'] del addr_pair['mac-address'] def _prepare_security_groups(client_manager, parsed_args): client = client_manager.network sec_grp_ids = [] for sec_grp_opt in parsed_args.security_groups: sec_grp = client.find_security_group(sec_grp_opt, ignore_missing=False) sec_grp_ids.append(sec_grp.id) if sec_grp_ids: parsed_args.security_groups = sec_grp_ids def _add_extension_options(parser): parser.add_argument( '--security-group', metavar='<security-group>', action='append', dest='security_groups', help='Security group associated with the port' ' (this option can be repeated)' ) parser.add_argument( '--extra-dhcp-opt', metavar='<opt-name>=<opt-value>[,ip-version={4,6}]', action=parseractions.MultiKeyValueAction, dest='extra_dhcp_opts', help='Extra dhcp options to be assigned to this port:' ' <opt-name>=<opt-value>[,ip-version={4,6}]' ' (this option can be repeated)' ) parser.add_argument( # TODO(singhj) add support to be able to specify name or ID. # Depends on sdk support of QoS extension '--qos-policy', metavar='<qos-policy-id>', help='Attach QoS policy(ID) to this port' ' (this option requires the Quality of Service extension)' ) parser.add_argument( '--allowed-address-pair', metavar='ip-address=<ip-address>[,mac-address=<mac-address>]', dest='allowed_address_pairs', action=parseractions.MultiKeyValueAction, required_keys=['ip-address'], optional_keys=['mac-address'], help='Allowed address pair associated with the port' ' (this option can be repeated)' ) _add_extension_options(parser) _add_extension_options(parser)
deleted_lines: attrs['network_id'] = parsed_args.network # TODO(singhj): Add support for extended options: # qos,security groups,dhcp, address pairs _network = client.find_network(parsed_args.network, ignore_missing=False) parsed_args.network = _network.id _prepare_fixed_ips(self.app.client_manager, parsed_args) _prepare_fixed_ips(self.app.client_manager, parsed_args)

commit_message:
Abstract a helper to add --project option

There is a add_project_domain_option_to_parser() in
openstackclient/identity/common.py which is widely
used in OSC. --project option is similar. So we can
add a similar helper to add --project option to a
parser.

This patch only uses this helper in network because
they are all the same. In other files, there are
also --project options with different help message.
Will deal with them in the future.

Change-Id: I73d137d061fcfd538263db04bc1b76b26fa31fe9

commit_message:
Make "--subnet" option of "network create" required

"--subnet" option "network create" of Compute network
is required.

Change-Id: I30f6e7ed052eb6345b20fb520ed56eecea99ae24

commit_message:
Feature: Add option to disable root_disk in flavor

This feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral root_disk on the hypervisor;
If root disk size is set to None, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I99bbf9b29100813609a62aa925600bc6bd4ba9c0
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Added option --is-domain to create project in keystone

This patch adds the option --is-domain to create keystone project
as a domain in keystone. Use the option --is-domain at
"openstack project create" to create a project as domain:

openstack project create --is-domain <project_name>

Without the --is-domain keystone will create a normal project.

Related-Bug: #1487600

Change-Id: I15934d572aea7821d23fc067ae214a6956fea361

commit_message:
Add auth example

examples/osc_auth.py is the auth flow currently used by OSC.  This will
form the basis for experimenting and validating additional authentication
processes.

It is not expected to be used in tests or in fact be a long-lived
member of examples/.  It is being checked into the repo as a way
of having a common distribution and basis for experimentation.

Change-Id: I2b40c75c729d76b03f081f5527bd5e318ac7a95a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/95/232695/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # osc-auth.py - Demonstrate OpenStackClient authentication flow # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ OpenStackClient Authentication Example Demonstrates the authentication process used by OpenStackClient """ import argparse import logging import sys import requests import common from openstackclient.api import auth as auth_mod from openstackclient.common import clientmanager from openstackclient.common import session as osc_session from os_client_config import config as cloud_config LOG = logging.getLogger('') def get_plugin_versions(cloud_config): """Get supported API versions from plugins and validate passed args returns - dict of api names and selected version """ # --- OpenStackShell.initialize_app() --- # Loop through extensions to get API versions api_version = {} for mod in clientmanager.PLUGIN_MODULES: default_version = getattr(mod, 'DEFAULT_API_VERSION', None) option = mod.API_VERSION_OPTION.replace('os_', '') version_opt = cloud_config.get(option, default_version) if version_opt: api = mod.API_NAME api_version[api] = version_opt # Add a plugin interface to let the module validate the version # requested by the user skip_old_check = False mod_check_api_version = getattr(mod, 'check_api_version', None) if mod_check_api_version: # this throws an exception if invalid skip_old_check = mod_check_api_version(version_opt) # Do the 'old' static version check mod_versions = getattr(mod, 'API_VERSIONS', None) if not skip_old_check and mod_versions: if version_opt not in mod_versions: LOG.warning( "%s version %s is not in supported versions %s" % (api, version_opt, ', '.join(mod.API_VERSIONS.keys()))) return api_version def run(opts): """Run the examples""" # --- OpenStackShell.initialize_app() --- LOG.debug("options: %s", opts) # Set the default plugin to token_endpoint if url and token are given if (opts.url and opts.token): # Use service token authentication auth_type = 'token_endpoint' else: auth_type = 'password' # Do configuration file handling # Ignore the default value of interface. Only if it is set later # will it be used. cc = cloud_config.OpenStackConfig( override_defaults={ 'interface': None, 'auth_type': auth_type, }, ) LOG.debug("defaults: %s", cc.defaults) cloud = cc.get_one_cloud( cloud=opts.cloud, argparse=opts, ) LOG.debug("cloud cfg: %s", cloud.config) api_version = get_plugin_versions(cloud.config) LOG.debug("api versions: %s" % api_version) # --- ClientManager.setup_auth() --- # Perform the ClientManager functions directly, in the same order # If no auth type is named by the user, select one based on # the supplied options auth_plugin_name = auth_mod.select_auth_plugin(cloud) # Basic option checking to avoid unhelpful error messages auth_mod.check_valid_auth_options(cloud, auth_plugin_name) # Skip password prompt # _auth_params = dict(cloud.auth) (auth_plugin, _auth_params) = auth_mod.build_auth_params( auth_plugin_name, cloud, ) # Skip default domain, user business # Skip tenant business LOG.debug('Using auth plugin: %s' % auth_plugin_name) LOG.debug('Using parameters %s' % _auth_params) auth = auth_plugin.load_from_options(**_auth_params) # needed by SAML authentication request_session = requests.session() session = osc_session.TimingSession( auth=auth, session=request_session, # verify=self._verify, # user_agent=USER_AGENT, ) # --- ClientManager.auth_ref() --- auth_ref = auth.get_auth_ref(session) # --- do something interesting with the auth here --- # List auth types data = [] for p in auth_mod.PLUGIN_LIST: data.append(( p.name, p.entry_point.__str__().split(' = ')[1], )) print("auth types: %s" % data) # Show auth values # This list is representative, not exhaustive auth_attrs = [ # 'auth_token', 'domain_id', 'domain_name', 'domain_scoped', 'expires', 'is_federated', 'issued', 'project_id', 'project_name', 'project_scoped', 'role_ids', 'role_names', 'scoped', 'trust_id', 'trust_scoped', 'trustee_user_id', 'trustor_user_id', 'username', 'user_id', 'version', ] data = {} if getattr(auth_ref, 'auth_token', None): # Don't carelessly leak valid tokens data['auth_token'] = '**********' for a in auth_attrs: v = getattr(auth_ref, a, None) if v: data[a] = v # print("auth_ref: %s" % auth_ref) print("selected auth type: %s" % auth_plugin_name) print("auth data: %s" % data) if __name__ == "__main__": parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='OpenStackClient Authentication Example') opts = common.base_parser( clientmanager.build_plugin_option_parser(parser), ).parse_args() common.configure_logging(opts) sys.exit(common.main(opts, run))

commit_message:
Add ability to attach qos-policy in network create

Able to specify qos-policy-id during network create:
$ openstack network create <name> --qos-policy <qos-policy-id>

Change-Id: I231bd8f2a4cf8f65c385eb43cf5423b028a0624b

commit_message:
Add support for service-names

Some services need to override service name. For instance, long-time
Rackspace customers can wind up with 2 compute services in their catalog
due to legacy slicehost.

Change-Id: I40317744ba36e7ac4ec0585bc8d813674229e74e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-12 05:18:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/image/client.py', 'requirements.txt', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/tests/fakes.py', 'openstackclient/image/v1/image.py', 'openstackclient/common/cachemanager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/6b249492518bdde85ac3bfe56045162988f006b6', 'message': 'Add CacheManager

This is an early exercise for a CacheManager (similar to ClientManager)
that contains all of the various object cache descriptors.  This is mostly
to validate this approach for handling the object cache instances.

* image list and image show are wired to cache the returned data; they
  use the same cache but the saved data is still all wrong and an image
  cached from image list is not found by image show.  The first problem is

Change-Id: I3661101e9d98a47259f878788bb7a5bbd3374aca

commit_message:
Add CacheManager

This is an early exercise for a CacheManager (similar to ClientManager)
that contains all of the various object cache descriptors.  This is mostly
to validate this approach for handling the object cache instances.

* image list and image show are wired to cache the returned data; they
  use the same cache but the saved data is still all wrong and an image
  cached from image list is not found by image show.  The first problem is
  that image list uses our internal API and image show still using glanceclient
  and caching an Image resource.  To be dealt with later...

Change-Id: I3661101e9d98a47259f878788bb7a5bbd3374aca

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """Manage access to object cache""" from dogpile import cache class CacheCache(object): """Descriptor class for caching created cache objects""" def __init__(self, factory): self.factory = factory self._handle = None def __get__(self, manager, owner): if self._handle is None: self._handle = self.factory(manager) return self._handle class CacheManager(object): """Manages access to API object caches""" def __init__( self, cache_class=None, ttl=None, path=None, ): """Set up a CacheManager CacheManager is similar to ClientManager in that i is a container for the object cache descriptors set up by each client. """ self.cache_class = cache_class or 'dogpile.cache.memory' self.ttl = ttl or 300 self.path = path def make_cache(manager): """Add a new cache to CacheManager""" new_cache = cache.make_region().configure( manager.cache_class, expiration_time=manager.ttl, ) return new_cache def add_cache_objects(object_list=None): """Set up the cache object attributes in CacheManager""" for co in object_list: setattr( CacheManager, co, CacheCache(make_cache), )

commit_message:
Log begin/end of log collection

The console log has output from the log collection,
but it's not clear that the output is part of a test
or something after the test.

This makes it clearer that the output between the
begin/end are related to log collection.

Change-Id: Iba374d89fa5c11f8690af73e87804cb29cb7fc9e
(cherry picked from commit 4bda4b9ea0bb4db63604d14fb44316b32c3f27b3)

commit_message:
Add object-rsync-timeout option

Adds the rsync_timeout option to to object-server.conf, so we can adjust
it away from the default of 900s.

If there are a number of large partitions needing replication,
occasionally one needs to adjust the timeout in order to allow the rsync
to complete rather than timeout and retry.

Note: Also includes change to amulet tests for validating the workers,
which is needed for the updated worker calculation count.

Change-Id: I2d895741cb0528836a675deb6399005a5bf59ab5
Depends-On: Ia250f45b4f734f5a25c1deebbf6d7fa5303b6ad9
Closes-bug: 1702039
(cherry picked from commit 18419a87c50f798b1468e7265b30836f70eba1d1)

commit_message:
Dual Stack VIPs

Enable dual stack IPv4 and IPv6 VIPs on the same interface.
HAProxy always listens on both IPv4 and IPv6 allowing connectivity
on either protocol.

charm-helpers sync for HAProxy template changes.

Change-Id: Icf210cd1f3aa836dd8b36edbbce73b3b2af68da7

commit_message:
Add lxml to tempest venv

Some tempest tests, including those for keystone, require lxml.
This patch ensure lxml exists in the tempest venv.

The backport was updated to avoid a merge conflict in the list of
tempest_pip_packages.

Change-Id: I0ad60d881d81edbcdd61c3c2cb474f6e73a69499
(cherry picked from commit b7c60f512b4944d39a52bf4b828aeadadd224698)

commit_message:
Un-use 'scope' attribute for wizard modal service

'scope' attribute for wizard modal service is deprecated.
It will be removed on Queens.
So this patch changes not to use 'scope' attribute.

Change-Id: Id716858468fcb05dcce9160809308b4213da923c
Closes-Bug: #1647995

commit_message:
Recon's get_diskusage and get_unmounted return all devs.

If account, container and object are on one server but use different devs,
then for example diskusage on account returns also object-only disks.

Change-Id: I78793328587a021436fdbddf8ff9731cb6182745
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/03/348803/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: recon = Scout("diskusage/%s" % self.server_type, self.verbose, self.suppress_errors, self.timeout)

commit_message:
Run sign-artifacts role on executor

I incorrectly assumed we delegated_to: localhost inside the role.  So
limit this to localhost to ensure it is run on the executor.

Change-Id: I39904d39131a576d679d0daa4dfd82ee485d0367
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add clarifying note about monitoring for branches during release

Change-Id: Ib995760e593bf3b8cdb0aa5a162377b0cbbce8d5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/76/497476/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: If any link flags are set to false or any projects are commented out, someone will need to periodically check for those documents to be published when the new branches are created in the affected projects. All branches should be created before the final release deadline, so it should be possible to update the project-data settings by then to have the site link to all of the latest documentation.

commit_message:
Add a reminder about novaclient versions for queens

I know this is unusual but an artefact of the release/requirements
process means that we need to release 9.2.0 from pike.  So we don't
inadvertently release 9.2.0 from queens add a warning/reminder.

Change-Id: I0fcddd04d68d7417e42eb2aeb296610d7aeb0d34

subject: Use resource collector for the fencing -> stonith ordering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-23 15:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/pacemaker.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/17396dcea8c8597e20f19b1f5867cb67554133ce', 'message': "Use resource collector for the fencing -> stonith ordering

Change Ifef08033043a4cc90a6261e962d2fdecdf275650 moved the stonith
property definition to the pacemaker_master node. This means that the
Class['tripleo::fencing'] -> Class['pacemaker::stonith'] ordering
breaks on non-boostrap pacemaker nodes because the pacemaker::stonith
property is not defined there any longer.

Let's fix this by simply using a resource collector and set the ordering
on that instead of adding yet anoth if statement. Ordering on
enablement of stonith is actually more correct formally.

Tested this on a broken setup successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1712605
Change-Id: I616d340bdf75da9d9eb8b83b2e804dff3d07d58e
"}]
commit_message:
Use resource collector for the fencing -> stonith ordering

Change Ifef08033043a4cc90a6261e962d2fdecdf275650 moved the stonith
property definition to the pacemaker_master node. This means that the
Class['tripleo::fencing'] -> Class['pacemaker::stonith'] ordering
breaks on non-boostrap pacemaker nodes because the pacemaker::stonith
property is not defined there any longer.

Let's fix this by simply using a resource collector and set the ordering
on that instead of adding yet anoth if statement. Ordering on
enablement of stonith is actually more correct formally.

Tested this on a broken setup successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1712605
Change-Id: I616d340bdf75da9d9eb8b83b2e804dff3d07d58e

commit_message:
Add support for updating initramfs images in CI

Add support for updating ironic-python-agent.initramfs images with
new or built packages/

Depends-On: I1dd4d6fa0629d498c4f0d30da33ff49844ca4068
Change-Id: I0d53f8fe9b457ac4741d8c97f5c27e31246cc269
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/00/479900/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - { role: repo-setup, repo_inject_image_path: "$HOME/ironic-python-agent.initramfs", repo_run_live: false, initramfs_image: true } - { role: install-built-repo, ib_repo_image_path: "$HOME/overcloud-full.qcow2", when: compressed_gating_repo is defined and not to_build|bool } - { role: install-built-repo, ib_repo_image_path: "$HOME/ironic-python-agent.initramfs", when: compressed_gating_repo is defined and not to_build|bool }
deleted_lines: # TODO:(sshnaidm) Support update of initramfs image https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1677275 # - { role: repo-setup, repo_inject_image_path: "$HOME/ironic-python-agent.initramfs", repo_run_live: false } - { role: install-built-repo, when: compressed_gating_repo is defined and not to_build|bool }

commit_message:
Move ovsdb_connection definition to Backend

ovsdb_connection is used in Backend, but defined only in
sub-classes. By moving the definiton to Backend, subclasses
don't need to define it even if they don't use it, and
Backend doesn't assume it's defined

Change-Id: I2e08fca268c4749e757a07fc6b335ae0fc283a75

subject: Remove RamFilter and DiskFilter in default filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-11 01:52:25.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/user/filter-scheduler.rst', 'doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/456fd13183411a13f6315fdcd0bb905d859cb9f5', 'message': 'Remove RamFilter and DiskFilter in default filter

commit 2fe96819c24eff5a9493a6559f3e8d5b4624a8c9
fixed the default filter settings and in doc we should
do it accordingly

commit_message:
Move common definition into common layer

move common definition into common layer, as dependency patches
like I64ad387ec7b532e9dbc791f683a005587825ff61 plan to use the
definitions of the schema, this patch moves these definitions
as common ones

commit_message:
Docker: Enable TLS in the internal network for libvirt

Bind mounts the necessary certs and keys to enable live migrations
using TLS.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Depends-On: I26a7748b37059ea37f460d8c70ef684cc41b16d3
Change-Id: I81efa85d916823f740bf320c88a248403743a45b

commit_message:
TLS-everywhere/libvirt: Make postsave command configurable

This is requires for when libvirt is running over a container, since
we shouldn't try to restart the libvirt process, but the container
itself.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Change-Id: I26a7748b37059ea37f460d8c70ef684cc41b16d3

commit_message:
Remove VMware driver _get_vm_ref_from_uuid method

VMware driver defines _get_vm_ref_from_uuid and _get_vm_ref_from_name
which have the same implementation.

This change removes _get_vm_ref_from_uuid to avoid code duplication and
updates _get_vm_ref_from_name docstring to integrate details from
_get_vm_ref_from_uuid docstring.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I952332528d69ef0c9b5959fdb0c3bb56bb4f19c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/444959/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Get reference to the VM with the name specified. This method reads all of the names of the VM's that are running on the backend, then it filters locally the matching vm_name. It is far more optimal to use _get_vm_ref_from_vm_uuid. """ _get_vm_ref_from_name(session, identifier))
deleted_lines: """Get reference to the VM with the name specified."""def _get_vm_ref_from_uuid(session, instance_uuid): """Get reference to the VM with the uuid specified. This method reads all of the names of the VM's that are running on the backend, then it filters locally the matching instance_uuid. It is far more optimal to use _get_vm_ref_from_vm_uuid. """ vms = session._call_method(vim_util, "get_objects", "VirtualMachine", ["name"]) return _get_object_from_results(session, vms, instance_uuid, _get_object_for_value) _get_vm_ref_from_uuid(session, identifier))

subject: How about not logging errors every time we shelve offload?
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-24 13:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/df6ea0412f462815cf57560e96f33f4e2ff9d072', 'message': 'How about not logging errors every time we shelve offload?

The delete_allocation_for_instance method does not return
anything and "if not None" is always True, so we're always
logging an error when we shelve offload an instance, which
is not the most fun thing in the world.

This was probably caused by some confusion with how
remove_provider_from_instance_allocation works which does
return a boolean result.

Change-Id: I30b716b0649f6d367ea747149da5c5f921ae19c5
Closes-Bug: #1712689
(cherry picked from commit e208cbb1f122b948af91a8d11c0f45dcec5bbc76)
'}]
commit_message:
How about not logging errors every time we shelve offload?

The delete_allocation_for_instance method does not return
anything and "if not None" is always True, so we're always
logging an error when we shelve offload an instance, which
is not the most fun thing in the world.

This was probably caused by some confusion with how
remove_provider_from_instance_allocation works which does
return a boolean result.

Closes-Bug: #1712689
(cherry picked from commit e208cbb1f122b948af91a8d11c0f45dcec5bbc76)

commit_message:
Fix no_proxy evaluation for Swarm clusters

At the moment, no_proxy variable is evaluated separately for docker
daemon and for swarm-manager container running in docker. Evaluated
value for swarm-manager is not getting into cloud-init script, because
$NODE_PROXY token is getting replaced by Heat str_replace function.
This commit is intended to unify NO_PROXY evaluation and also fix the
issue with swarm-manager.

Related-Bug: #1647815
Related-Bug: #1632698
Related-Bug: #1660562
Change-Id: I336024265008b6cae308bf7b614476b71b81fa01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/06/457806/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -n "$HTTP_PROXY" -o -n "$HTTPS_PROXY" ]; then if [ -n "$NO_PROXY" ]; then cat <<EOF | sed "s/^ *//" > $DOCKER_NO_PROXY_CONF [Service] Environment=NO_PROXY=$NO_PROXY DOCKER_RESTART=1 if [ -f "$BASH_RC" ]; then echo "declare -x no_proxy=$NO_PROXY" >> $BASH_RC else echo "File $BASH_RC does not exist, not setting no_proxy" fi
deleted_lines: if [ -n "$NO_PROXY" ]; then cat <<EOF | sed "s/^ *//" > $DOCKER_NO_PROXY_CONF [Service] Environment=NO_PROXY=$NO_PROXY DOCKER_RESTART=1 if [ -f "$BASH_RC" ]; then echo "declare -x no_proxy=$NO_PROXY" >> $BASH_RC else echo "File $BASH_RC does not exist, not setting no_proxy" fi else cat <<EOF | sed "s/^ *//" > $DOCKER_NO_PROXY_CONF [Service] Environment=NO_PROXY=$SWARM_API_IP,$ETCD_SERVER_IP,$SWARM_NODE_IP EOF DOCKER_RESTART=1 if [ -f "$BASH_RC" ]; then echo "declare -x no_proxy=$SWARM_API_IP,$ETCD_SERVER_IP,$SWARM_NODE_IP" >> $BASH_RC else echo "File $BASH_RC does not exist, not setting no_proxy"

commit_message:
Reduce package set to install via bindep

The build-essential meta-package is a very large
set. We only need gcc and the others listed in
order to support pip and Ansible. The fewer we
install via bindep, the greater the chance we
have of figuring out what's missing from each
role's distro package list.

Change-Id: I97f068eb1368fccb61be900625e5b5dcbf77d527
(cherry picked from commit 078e50f7ef416ef99b11b7afe9958509ff9c0e4f)

commit_message:
Reduce package set to install via bindep

The build-essential meta-package is a very large
set. We only need gcc and the others listed in
order to support pip and Ansible. The fewer we
install via bindep, the greater the chance we
have of figuring out what's missing from each
role's distro package list.

Change-Id: I97f068eb1368fccb61be900625e5b5dcbf77d527
(cherry picked from commit 078e50f7ef416ef99b11b7afe9958509ff9c0e4f)

commit_message:
hardware offload support for openvswitch

In Kernel 4.12 we introduced Traffic Control (TC see [1]) hardware offloads
framework for SR-IOV VFs which allows us to configure the NIC [2].
Subsequent OVS patches [3] allows us to use the TC framework
to offload OVS datapath rules. This feature is supported in OVS 2.8.0.
netvirt patch [4] is also necessary to make this work with ODL netvirt
backend.

This patch allow ODL mech driver to bind direct (SR-IOV) port.

[1] http://netdevconf.org/1.2/papers/efraim-gerlitz-sriov-ovs-final.pdf
[2] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/738176/
[3] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2017-April/330606.html
[4] https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/60259/

Change-Id: Id4a44d7a128fafc889416077eb88d504dcc9ee0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/36/448536/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
51-hosts fails if given lots of changes

The issue is how awk is used to update hosts files.  When
os-apply-config produces sufficiently large amounts of lines
to be added (or ensure in) hosts files, awk will error out.
To work around it, instead use sed, and reconstruct the
host file(s) to ensure the entries between the comment delimeters
of "# HEAT_HOSTS_START" and "# HEAT_HOSTS_END" are swapped with
the new entries.

Also get rid of blank lines produced by os-apply-config

Partial-Bug: #1674732
Change-Id: Ibe0a9f6ec10d55750e3b0e16301236141f988d69

subject: Fix test_keepalived_ipv6_support for Keepalived v1.2.20
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-23 11:03:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/334a1ed7d52afa21230db8588dd4cc1673386ae3', 'message': 'Fix test_keepalived_ipv6_support for Keepalived v1.2.20

In commit [1] (some explanation in [2] ) VRRP initialisation is enhanced
to read source IP address(to use when sending VRRP packets) from the
HA interface or from keepalived config("unicast_src_ip" parameter).
If it is unable to find IP address, VRRP initialisation will fail with
error "Cannot find an IP address to use for interface".

In the test, we set vrrp->family to AF_INET by setting vip to
169.254.0.1/24 through config, but not providing source IPv4 address(i.e
no 'unicast_src_ip' option or no IP on HA interface), making the test
to fail with [1]. To fix that, we set the IP address on HA interface.

Note: Commit [1] is added in Keepalived version 1.2.20.
Tested the fix on both Keepalived v1.2.19 and Keepalived v1.2.20.

[1] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/commit/37488e57
[2] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/issues/445

Closes-bug: #1712388
Change-Id: I260c0e6810ed54c93f93621afa6ab13855ef2428
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_keepalived_ipv6_support for Keepalived v1.2.20

In commit [1] (some explanation in [2] ) VRRP initialisation is enhanced
to read source IP address(to use when sending VRRP packets) from the
HA interface or from keepalived config("unicast_src_ip" parameter).
If it is unable to find IP address, VRRP initialisation will fail with
error "Cannot find an IP address to use for interface".

In the test, we set vrrp->family to AF_INET by setting vip to
169.254.0.1/24 through config, but not providing source IPv4 address(i.e
no 'unicast_src_ip' option or no IP on HA interface), making the test
to fail with [1]. To fix that, we set the IP address on HA interface.

Note: Commit [1] is added in Keepalived version 1.2.20.
Tested the fix on both Keepalived v1.2.19 and Keepalived v1.2.20.

[1] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/commit/37488e57
[2] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/issues/445

Closes-bug: #1712388
Change-Id: I260c0e6810ed54c93f93621afa6ab13855ef2428
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/496615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix default qos policy when creating network

In _create_network_policy(), policy object is passed into _get_policy_obj()
although it expects to be passed policy id. This patch passes policy id
instead of policy object and adds a unit test and API tests.

Change-Id: Ic4c755c54d93d7ca3312b432b7c1e6770f25c359
Closes-bug: #1712278

commit_message:
Update policy on rule addition/removal

The problem was addressed by calling rpc_update_firewall_policy
after insert/remove firewall rule.

Added unit tests.

Also added a covering scenario test, implemented
insert_firewall_rule_in_policy/ remove_firewall_rule_from_policy
in tempest tester and performed minor cleanup of related code
(unused parameter removal, commented code). Enforced validation
of firewall_rule_id for rule insert/remove.

Co-Authored-By: Elena Ezhova <eezhova@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I58eda38f70e5ed5b8867fbef05b7c9ccd7155f47
Closes-Bug: #1711391

commit_message:
Containerized deployment with pacemaker via OOOQ

When deploying containerized and enable_pacemaker is set to true, make
sure to include the docker-ha.yaml file.

Also this cleans up the `when` conditional, which allows to remove the
docker.yaml file from network_args, which prevents network_args from
unwantedly overriding docker-ha.yaml contents from container_args.

Change-Id: I5f28d2f784b9cd381ba370c9635300fe0ed79845
Partial-Bug: #1712070

subject: Delete instance allocations when the instance is deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-24 03:25:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1b2f3c7bb25667527e7e1d2afd84d5d5533e7751', 'message': 'Delete instance allocations when the instance is deleted

In a deployment that still has Ocata computes, the resource
tracker will delete the allocations for an instance when it
is deleted, but in an all-Pike+ computes deployment, the
allocations will only be removed for a deleted instance
during the update_available_resource periodic task.

The capacity on the node should be freed as soon as the
instance is deleted, like when we shelve offload an
instance, so this does that.

The ServerMovingTests functional tests were glossing over
this by forcing the run of the update_available_resource
periodic task code after the instance was deleted but
before checking the allocations were gone from Placement.
So this change removes that part of the tests to show
this fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I0f57b4ba8e4c3931b70bd737de5b7c8ae47f033d
Closes-Bug: #1712684
(cherry picked from commit d6de0e57c21472b99cbe71ec62b3967ef7282dec)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete instance allocations when the instance is deleted

In a deployment that still has Ocata computes, the resource
tracker will delete the allocations for an instance when it
is deleted, but in an all-Pike+ computes deployment, the
allocations will only be removed for a deleted instance
during the update_available_resource periodic task.

The capacity on the node should be freed as soon as the
instance is deleted, like when we shelve offload an
instance, so this does that.

The ServerMovingTests functional tests were glossing over
this by forcing the run of the update_available_resource
periodic task code after the instance was deleted but
before checking the allocations were gone from Placement.
So this change removes that part of the tests to show
this fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I0f57b4ba8e4c3931b70bd737de5b7c8ae47f033d
Closes-Bug: #1712684
(cherry picked from commit d6de0e57c21472b99cbe71ec62b3967ef7282dec)

commit_message:
functional: Fix reference to ovsdb connection

Change I379448fd135a3bb2ac99709812b9f476c73923a7 replaced connection
attribute of IDL to ovsdb_connection. After updating upper constraints
to newer ovsdbapp version, we no longer have connection attribute.

Change-Id: I6f060fff4df7323a3877f56cb1fa586a22d16670
Closes-bug: #1712594

commit_message:
Prevent check haproxy script from generating meaningless logs

Redirect the logs into /dev/null. Otherwise, it will be collected by
docker engine, which is meaningless.

Change-Id: I7d1d4cac61e62144bc11c26e7b00fc21037eb8d1
Closes-Bug: #1708097

commit_message:
Use https for NODEPOOL_RDO_PROXY outside of gate

When we changes this in Ia06ebad96c8db2a4eb732e80f04c72ad4c9bc6a3 we
switch from https to http. Change this back to https.

Change-Id: I8034cc49a9834cc0c1be35ea1fb1b14e4eae3fc6
Related-Bug: #1712785
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
